reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I planned a spontaneous getaway for a long weekend, a week later we arrived in Chicago by bus at 7 AM. We planned on sight seeing for the day until we could check into our hotel at 3... but after a long bus ride and a night of no sleep, we were cranky and miserable. We called the front desk to see if there was ANY way we might be able to check in around noon?-- they told us we could check in that moment, at 7am! They saved the day! we were greeted by VERY welcoming staff, were not charged extra for checking in early, and were told we could enjoy the buffet breakfast-- which was music to our ears, we were starving! We were expecting coffee, juice and bagels, the usual-- but the breakfast was absolutely amazing. Fresh fruit, omelettes, sausage and biscuits and gravy, hot cinnamon rolls, yogurt, anything and everything, with a large, pretty dining room with plenty of room to sit down and enjoy. We stayed on the 9th floor in a standard queen, it was right by the elevator but noise was never a problem. My boyfriend is a very big guy, but the small rooms were never a problem. They were comfy, clean, and a great place to relax after a long day of seeing the city, which was exactly what we needed. No, they are not luxury rooms. No, you should not bring the contents of your entire closet. If you're traveling with kids, I'm sure the double queen rooms would be just fine, unless you're planning on camping out in your hotel room all day. But with such a great location (we walked everywhere!! longest walk was 20 minutes, but we didn't mind, we just got to see even more of the city!) who wants to stay in their room all day? Overall, we had a great time. We had a comfy place to sleep in the heart of Chicago, with very friendly staff and yummy breakfast to start off our days of exploring. Would definitely stay here again, even if we're not on a budget.
reviews.title: Great value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the best hotel we stayed in, it was so comfortable, clean and in a great location. The location was brilliant and within walking distance of a lot of day and night time activities. Everyone was really helpful and friendly and the staff were very accommodating. The free breakfast was second to none! If you're staying in Chicago you should definitely stay here
reviews.title: AMAZING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My title best describes our room! Perfect for one. Two, if you love the one you're with! Though small, it was quite charming. Built in 1925, it was nice to stay in updated/renovated history. Since we spent so little time in the room, it wasn't an issue. The staff rocked, special thanks thanks to Hodji, the bellman who met us at the door and brought up our bags. Also thanks to Lorraine, our housekeeper, who kept our room. The bellmen/doorman always greeted us with smiles and pleasantries. The location was awesome, close to everything and everyplace you want to go. In addition to its proximity to the Lake Front, the Magnificent Mile, State Street, award winning restaurants and numerous attractions, there was also a Trader Joe's just around the corner. In addition, a Jewel Foods and Walgreens were close by. Other than toothpaste splatters on the wall around the bathroom sink, the rooms were kept pretty clean.
reviews.title: Charming and Cozy and Perfect for Togetherness!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was great. Service staff was very friendly and helpful. Note that the rooms are very small. It used to be Hotel Cass, but now it is owned by Holiday. It still has the old charm. It is perfect if you aren't going to spend much time in your room. They are updated and clean. The bathroom sink seemed to be a little clogged, though. Great location, too. And I must mention the free breakfast, which included a lot of food.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in the city

reviews.text: The hotel is newly renovated. The free breakfast was great. The staff is very helpful. The price was exceptional for this great location. The room...is small there is no other way to put it. We had a corner room so I actually think we had move space. Having said that it is the city and space is at a premium. The room was clean and the bathroom was completely updated. Again, there is so much to see and do hanging out in the room wasn't a concern. If you happen to be from NYC you won't even bat an eye.
reviews.title: The best little room in Chicago

reviews.text: Convenient location, clean rooms and remodeled bathrooms with a boutique feel.
reviews.title: Very cozy... too cozy for me...
Freaky tiny rooms
reviews.text: Great location but the rooms were beyond tiny and in poor condition. If you wanted to open the door all the way you had to put your suitcase on the bed. Way too small for two people. Wallpaper was peeling off and the decor was not attractive. Not worth the expense of almost 180 plus tax

I was very pleased with my experience at this hotel. The price was good for my needs and the location was perfect, just a short walk to Michigan ave. I was not expecting the same level of service you would receive at a higher priced hotel, but I did receive it. The bellman immediately had my bags out of the taxi on arrival and took them inside for me. When leaving, they took care of getting me a cab back to the airport and loaded my luggage. It was a beautiful setting, great history and the space in my room was well utilized. I would definitely come back.
reviews.title: Excellent location and value...great stay

reviews.text: Booked two rooms for a guys weekend. We liked the location of the hotel. Price was a little on the high side, but it was in downtown Chicago, so it was to be expected. We had a room with a view, but they are very few in the hotel, because of its odd shape and location. The rooms were small, but not uncomfortably or inconveniently so. The hotel was built in the '20s, and under the modern veneer, its age is visible in the layout. The breakfast was great, fully stocked, and the constantly being replenished. The staff was fantastic, from the front desk, doormen, maintenance and the cleaning staff, all friendly, approachable and professions. We had a great time, and would definitely stay again. The beds were also great. The only annoyance, and a minor one at that, was the parking garage across the street. Everytime someone exits the garage, an annoying alarm sounds to warn pedestrians of the cars approach. It is very loud, clearly audible in our room. It took me three days to figure out what it was.
reviews.title: Excellent staff, great breakfast, tiny rooms...

reviews.text: This is a smaller hotel with a great history. Rooms are small but updated and clean. Service is wonderful. I stayed here by myself visiting my son. Its convenient to the red line making it easy to meet up and get from the airport. The location is right near many restaurants and shopping. If you are looking for a reasonable rate and a good location this is it. They serve a buffet breakfast in the morning. It was originally the Cass hotel which was built in the 1920's so it has some history to it too. What a great location!
reviews.title: Great location and prices

reviews.text: I too selected this property based on the reviews. The hotel calls this a "European Style" hotel. Having never been to Europe I thought this meant simple furniture and a continental breakfast which is provided. It meant tiny rooms! Still I was very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and pleasant and the bed very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location fantastic! The price, staff, comfort of the bed, location and quality light breakfast makes this a hotel I would frequent again and recommend. Be warned the rooms are amazingly tiny!
reviews.title: classic mid city hotel with a modern feel

description: Welcome to our Holiday Inn Express Magnificent Mile Hotel. Our downtown Chicago hotel, conveniently located off Michigan Avenue on the Magnificent Mile, is situated in the heart of Chicago near several businesses and attractions. Business travelers will appreciate our downtown Chicago hotel location near major companies such as Deloitte, Boeing, AT&T, Sun Microsystems, Computer Sciences Corp. and Northwestern Hospital. Flying into Chicago? Our Chicago hotel is close to O'Hare (18 miles) and Midway (12 miles) Airports, saving time for the busy executive. Staying at this landmark Chicago hotel will make it easy to visit popular Chicago attractions like the Shedd Aquarium, the Art Institute, Navy Pier, Lincoln Park Zoo and Millennium Park. Catch a game with one of the 16 professional sports teams in town. At our Chicago downtown hotel, you're just 2 blocks away from Michigan Ave, Chicago's Magnificent Mile. Newly renovated, this historic Holiday Inn Express Magnificent Mile hotel has 175 guestrooms and 3 suites. The public areas reflect 1920s Beaux Arts' architecture and feature a great room with comfortable seating areas for the complimentary Express Start breakfast. Our Chicago hotel provides a chic, urban setting that is Wi-Fi friendly, stylishly updated and convenient to downtown businesses and attractions. Whether you visit Chicago for business or vacation travel, stay comfortably at our Magnificent Mile hotel.
